entry.title: Sour Batch Hop
entry.summary:
Score: 72 (out of 100) / Rank: 28th (out of 155 beers) / A green beer and my kids were excited seeing this one as they love sour patch kids sweets. My daughter tried to steal it after trying it.
Now this one was very sweet but could still get the beer taste coming through.
Check out how I rank all the beers I have tried on my Non-Alcoholic Beer Journey)

entry.title: Innis & Gunn
entry.summary:
Score: 40 (out of 100) / Rank: 110th (out of 155 beers) / I thought I had tried this before but it was their pale ale Innis & nonn.
This one poured with a nice head and left a nice head trail down the glass as I drank it was crisp but lack a bit of flavour.

entry.title: Woodcutter
entry.summary:
Score: 55 (out of 100) / Rank: 76th (out of 155 beers) / A brown ale which poured nice and dark with a slight coffee smell and some light bubbles.
I was expecting this to have a strong dark taste but it was actually a smooth light coffee taste. It went down really well.
Check out how I rank all the beers I have tried on my Non-Alcoholic Beer Journey)

entry.title: Dry Hopped Stout
entry.summary:
Score: 45 (out of 100) / Rank: 103rd (out of 155 beers) / Another new Brulo beer to try in my Brulo glass and as always it poured perfectly even it is a bit darker than my normal.
A nice smell with a strong taste but without being over powering. It went down really well after a stressful day.

entry.title: Easy Sunshine
entry.summary:
Score: 41 (out of 100) / Rank: 109th (out of 155 beers) / Probably the clearest beer I’ve had for a while which you can see in the picture but as it settled it became cloudy.
This one had a strong fruity smell but I didn’t get anything fruity in the taste, it was clean and crisp.
